English.Char_Desc_2000:
GoalieGoals is a free web application designed to help you create, manage, and achieve SMART goals. It allows you to quickly determine if you are on track to meet your goals. Additionally, it allows you to see how far ahead or behind you are on achieving goals. This kind of instant visual feedback is critical to helping you stay motivated and be successful.
GoalieGoals helps you set goals that follow the SMART(ER) principles for goal setting.
Specific Measurable Action-based Result-based Time-bound Evaluate Reevaluate
Take the goal 'Eat 2 vegetables 1 times a day starting 2013-10-27 and ending 2013-11-27' as an example. The goal is specific by defining:
What action you should do ('Eat 2 Vegetables') How often you should do it ('1 times a day') How long you should do it ('for 1 month')
The goals are always measurable since the expectations to achieve the goal can be quantified into a daily requirement. With this information, we can determine if each Goal has had enough progress to be 'Passing' or 'Failing' on a given day. This is shown as the status of the Goals on the Goal page and in more detail for each individual goal in the Logs page.
We can also evaluate and if necessary reassess our goals if we are falling behind due to being overly ambitious. The above serves as a good example of what it would look like if we stretched a little too far with a goal.
Final Goal Target In order to fully achieve our end goal, we will need to eat a total of '62 Vegetables'. Seeing the total requirement helps us visualize our end goal and gives us a better feel for how attainable is our goal.
